events.message: Customer reported an accident involving their vehicle on the morning of April 1st near Main Street intersection.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident after reviewing the details mentioned in the initial filing.
An agent was assigned promptly to manage the claim and begin communication with the customer.
The customer was sent an acknowledgment email confirming receipt of the auto accident claim.
Request sent for police report, photos of vehicle damage, and medical bills related to injuries from the accident.
Customer uploaded all requested documents including police report and medical invoice through the online portal.
Investigation team began reviewing the submitted evidence to assess liability and damages for the auto accident.
Investigation concluded that the customer was not at fault and damage assessment was completed accordingly.
A settlement offer was prepared and sent to the customer covering repair costs and medical expense reimbursement.
Customer responded positively to the settlement offer and expressed satisfaction with the communication received.
The claim was formally approved following customer agreement to the proposed settlement terms.
Payment for the approved settlement amount was successfully issued to the customer's bank account.
The auto accident claim file was officially closed after confirmation that all payments and documentation were completed.
The claim records were archived securely within the claims management system for future reference and compliance.
